title: Escalation of Freshdesk tickets to developers
description:
Stage 0. Ticket with some FR/custom development is received

We basically want to eliminate custom developments. Thus if you received some feature request from client, please use the following Canned Response and link ticket to Jira (stage 1) for further review on the Triage:

 

We currently do not support the feature you have described, however, 
we have put your request into our product backlog. 
This means that the feature request will be considered for implementation in a future release.
If the status of the feature changes to planned or implementation, then we may reach out to you
at that time with questions or feedback.

 

Stage 1: A new Freshdesk ticket to development


Support engineer has a ticket that should be forwarded to the developers. 

He/She should setup the appropriate Freshdesk fields and click update button to apply changes:


Stage 2: Link FD with Jira


1. Before creation of a new Jira ticket, please login to Jira (https://sippysoft.atlassian.net) and re-check if the requested feature or bug doesn't exist on Jira already;


2. If Jira ticket is already exist, please Link the Freshdesk ticket with the existed ticket on Jira by id:


Click to the below sign in the freshdesk ticket:


In the opened window you have to click to the marked below hyper-link:

 
Set the proper FD status accordingly. See quick notes in the end of the documentation with details how to identify what status should be installed for the FD ticket.

3. If ticket on Jira doesn't exist, please create a new Jira ticket.


  • Use always "Project" = "Triage". 
  • "Issue Type" could be different. Follow logic and set the most suitable value (if you found a bug in the ticket, use "issue type" = "bug", etc.)
  • "Assignee" could be "Arthur Kamyshniy, Oleksandr Nykytiuk, Pavel Bussel" but better leave it Unassigned.
  • "Summary" - subject of the issue/bug/feature etc.
  • "Reporter" for support should match the Jira login of the engie who links the ticket

 
 3.1 Modify a jira ticket before delegation it to Arthur/Anton/Pavel/Alex for further Triage:



Notify Arthur/Anton/Pavel in RYVER chat (support talks room) about newly created ticket and they will discuss it on Triage then.

3.2 Send a newly created jira ticket (or reopened ticket) to Anton/Arthur/Pavel/Alex via email or directly via chat to discuss it further on the TRIAGE.

Stage 3: Jira tickets Triage

Participators on the Triage are: Phillip M., Arthur K., Anton H., Alex N., Pavel B., and a rotating Developer;
On the "Triage" meeting, participants will discussing a new (and time permitting existing) tickets from the Support Triage queue.  At this time the issue's priority, business impact, and relevance will be evaluated and weighed against developer time to implement.  Once these factors have been evaluated these will be slotted into an appropriate time and place.  Not all items will be corrected through this process and emphasis should be geared towards priority, difficulty, and it's potential benefits for all our customers.

Comments will be added to the Jira ticket.  Comment should be forwarded automatically to the appropriate Freshdesk ticket that was linked with Jira ticket earlier. Also the "TR"(Triage) ticket is moving to "SS"(Sippy Softswitch) queue if it was approved by participators.

The Sales team will have a similar but separate triage meeting and format.  This is advantageous for two reasons.  The Sales triage will likely reveal features commonly requested by potential customers and will generally be proactive things we can work on to generate new business.  This is more of a proactive approach.  The support triage will more consistently reveal existing issues and deficiencies and be more of a reactive response to issues experienced by our customers.  Items brought up by both triage groups further highlight the needs of the company as a whole.

Support staff checks ALL FD tickets linked to the Jira TT upon receiving the comment from Jira and posts the reply to the customer/changes the status of the linked tickets accordingly

Stage 4: Support replies to the client about status of development (after Triage)

There are two possible decisions:
  • development has been approved on the stage of Triage
If "Triage" participators decided to move forward with the development of the requested functionality, support staff replies to the customer about the status of the development and assign for the Freshdesk ticket a new status "Wait on Dev Scrum"
  •  development has been declined on the stage of triage

If "Triage" participators decided to decline the requested development, support staff replies to the client with the existing canned response "Feature request has been totally declined"


Support staff checks ALL FD tickets linked to the Jira TT upon receiving the comment from Jira and posts the reply to the customer/changes the status of the linked tickets accordingly.


NOTE, support engineer should provide an explanation to customer why the issue has been declined if some reason has been provided as a comment in the Jira ticket. The related line is marked in bold in the canned response.

Stage 5: Change status for Freshdesk ticket

Status of Freshdesk ticket directly depends on Stage 4.

  • if the development has been approved on the Triage, then apply the following values for the ticket fields:


  • if the development has been declined, then apply the following values for the ticket fields:

Stage 5: Dev planning session


Participators: Maxim S., Phillip M., Pavel B., Andriy P., Eugen D.;
Development planning Sessions occur roughly every 2-3 weeks.  On the "Dev Planning Session" participants making a final decision about the discussed on the "Triage" tickets. After the "Dev Planning Session", Pavel leaves a comment on Jira with some agreed decision (like "Added to sprint 10" or development declined).

Support staff checks ALL FD tickets linked to the Jira TT upon receiving the comment from Jira and posts the reply to the customer/changes the status of the linked tickets accordingly.

  • if development has been approved, support engineer doing a change in status to the new one "Closed/Awaiting for the implementation" for all freshdesk tickets that are linked with one Jira ticket and using canned response "Closed/Awaiting for the implementation" notify clients manually:



See auto-reply for the full understanding of process: 
Dear customer,

This is an automated notification! We would like to update you about the status change in your ticket.
The case has been placed to the backlog of our developers so that they can consider it in further versions of the product.

Currently we do not have the final estimations for the feature to be delivered, we'll let you know when the development is done.
If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact us by replying to this email.

 

  • if development declined, support is closing ALL linked Freshdesk tickets and answer to each ticket with the existing canned response "Development Declined";
NOTE, support engineer should provide an explanation to customer why the issue has been declined if some reason has been provided as a comment in the Jira ticket. The related line is marked in bold in the canned response.
Stage 6: Development is ready

Support staff checks ALL FD tickets linked to the Jira TT upon receiving the comment from Jira and posts the reply to the customer/changes the status of the linked tickets accordingly.

Normally the update needs to be scheduled to apply the change.
But in some cases issue can be fixed in TRUNK version (before release of a new version). In such case support should create a ticket like "Waiting for x.x version" and add client's ticket to it. Thus when a stable version will be released we will update all clients who will be mentioned in the ticket  "Waiting for x.x version" and who were waiting for the stable release.







============================== Quick Notes ==============================

What status should set for a FD ticket that was linked to any Jira ticket? How to make a proper decision see the following notes:

Triage

All tickets with prefix TR-xxx on jira should have status TRIAGE in freshdesk ticket. Sometimes ticket on Jira could be moved to SS-xxx queue but in fact it could still requires a Triage. Such tickets could be detected by the following criterias:
  • see if some comment has been left in Jira ticket, it could help you to identify if this case has been already discussed and waits for Dev Scrum or it still requires Triage;
  •  if you see a future sprint has been set for the Jira ticket, then it means that ticket waits on Dev Scrum and status of FD ticket should be set accordingly;
  • if you see a sprint number with past ver. then triage is needed and FD status will be Triage;
  • notify Arthur and Anton about newly created Jira ticket in "support talks" in Ryver.


Wait on Dev Scrum

Tickets that are waiting for Dev Scrum is almost always have a prefix SS-xxx. Only in some cases it could be a comment in Jira ticket that it still requires review on Triage or ticket depends on some other ticket and additional review on Triage requires.

Closed/Awaiting for implementation

  If you see that "Sprint" field in some Jira ticket is not empty it  means that this ticket has been already scheduled for implementation.

Thus you can set status "Closed/Awaiting for implementation"

title: Freshdesk chat instead of support skype (for support only)
description:
General information


This document describes how to deal with cases when clients are asking support to organize a quick chat to resolve some urgent case. Or if customer asks support to add him to support skype.


How to deal with such cases:


1. Explain to the client that according to company policy all issues Sippy support team discussing with clients via ticket. You can use the following canned response: Skype policy

2. If client has some very urgent case and there is no possibility to resolve the issue quickly without chat, support can organize direct messaging via integrated into Freshdesk "chat".

3. To activate the Freshdesk chat - click button on the agent portal(like on screenshot below):

4. Give the instruction to the client how to find this chat from their side. We have a separate document that describes steps to find it on the customer portal. This documentation is internal, thus please send it to the client in reply to the ticket. Link to that document see below:
http://support.sippysoft.com/solution/articles/3000050705-how-to-find-open-chat-on-the-freshdesk-portal

See how to insert it to the ticket:





6. If some other client detected that chat is available and writing you some questions, you can ignore such request and proceed with supporting of a particular client.

7. When you finish with help to some particular client, it is enough to deactivate chat to avoid constant messages from other clients.


P.S. please try to avoid of adding clients to the sippy_software_inc._support skype. Instead of skype we are planning to use freshdesk chat, to reduce inconvenient requests from clients in skype.

title: Escalation of Freshdesk tickets to Billing department
